  between themto make lst 1a list of only even nu mbers.
  There is no limit on thenumber of exchangedeleme nts between lst1 a n d lst2.
  If it is possible to exchangeelements between the lst1 an d lst2 to make
  all the  elements of l st1 to be even, r eturn "YES".
  Otherwise, retu rn "NO".
  For example:
  exchange([1, 2, 3, 4], [1, 2, 3, 4]) => "YES"
  exchange([1, 2, 3, 4], [1, 5, 3, 4]) => "NO"
  It is assumed that the input lists will be non-empty.
  */
const exchange = (lst1, lst2) => {
  let res = [];
  let i = 0;
  let j = 0;
  let k = 0;
  let l = lst1.length;
  let r = lst2.length;
  while (i < l && j < r) {
    if (lst1[i] % 2 === lst2[j % 2]) {
      res.push(lst1[i]);
      i++;
      j++;
    } else {
      res.push(lst2[j % 2]);
      j++;
    }
  }
  return res.every(x => x % 2 === 0);
};

  histogram('a b b a') == {'a': 2, 'b': 2}
  histogram('a b c a b') == {'a': 2, 'b': 2}
  histogram('b b b b a') == {'b': 4}
  histogram('') == {}

  */
const histogram = (test) => {
  const letters = test.split(' ');
  const letterMap = {};
  let maxCount = 0;
  let maxLetter = '';
  for (let i = 0; i < letters.length; i++) {
    const letter = letters[i];
    const letterCount = letterMap[letter];
    if (letterCount > maxCount) {
      maxCount = letterCount;
      maxLetter = letter;
    }
    letterMap[letter] = letterCount + 1;
  }
  return { letterMap, maxCount, maxLetter };
};

/**
 * @param {number[]} nums
 * @return {number[]}
 */
var removeDuplicates = function(nums) {
  let result = [];
  let seen = {};
  for (let i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {
    let num = nums[i];
    if (!seen[num]) {
      result.push(num);
      seen[num] = true;
    }
  }
  return result;
};

/**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * function TreeNode(val) {
 *     this.val = val;
 *     this.left = this.right = null;
 * }
 */
/**
 * @param {number[]} nums
 * @return {number}
 */
var countWays = function(nums) {
  let result = 0;
  let root = new TreeNode(0);
  for (let i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {
    let num = nums[i];
    if (num === 0) {

    }
    if (root.val <= num) {
      root.left = root.right = root;
      root.val = num;
      result++;
    }
  }
  return result;
};

// https://leetcode.com/problems/find-the-number-of-unique-elements-in-an-array/
/**
 * @param {number[]} nums
 * @return {number}
 */
var findUniqueElements = function (nums) {
  let count = 0;
  let max = 0;
  let maxIndex = 0;
  for (let i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {
    if (nums[i] > max) {
      max = nums[i];
      maxIndex = i;
    }
  }
  for (let i = maxIndex + 1; i < nums.length; i++) {
    if (nums[i] === max) {
      count++;
    }
  }
  return count;
};

  return re.test(email);
};

  const re = /^((\+?1\s*[\-\(\]{0,2})?)?(\(?\d{3}\)?[\-\(\]{0,2})?)?[-. ]?((\(\d{3}\)|(\d{3}[\-\. ])|(\d{4}[\-\. ])|(\d{5}[\-\. ])|(\d{6})[\-\. ])?\d{3}[\-\. ]?\d{4}$/;

};

};

  console.assert(JSON.stringify(factorize(2)) === JSON.stringify([2]))
  console.assert(JSON.stringify(factorize(4)) === JSON.stringify([2, 2]))
  console.assert(JSON.stringify(factorize(8)) === JSON.stringify([2, 2, 2]))
  console.assert(JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 19)) === JSON.stringify([3, 19]))

      JSON.stringify([3, 3, 19, 19])
  )
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 19 * 3 * 19 * 3 * 19)) ===
      JSON.stringify([3, 3, 3, 19, 19, 19])
  )
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 19 * 19 * 19)) ===
      JSON.stringify([3, 19, 19, 19])
  )
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(factorize(3 * 2 * 3)) === JSON.stringify([2, 3, 3])
  )
}

<|endoftext|>/* From a lis t of  integ e rs, re move allelements that occur m ore than once. Keep order of elem ents left the same as  in the inpu t.
  >>> removeDuplicates([1, 2, 3, 2, 4])
  [1, 3, 4]
  */
const removeDuplicates = (numbers) => {
  const seen = new Set();
  return numbers.reduce((acc, cur) => {
    if (seen.has(cur)) {
      acc.push(cur);
    } else {
      seen.add(cur);
    }
    return acc;
  }, []);
};

<|endoftext|>/* For a give n st ring,f lip lo wercase c haracters to uppercas e and uppercase to lowercase.
  >>> flipCase('Hello')
  'hELLO'
  */
const flipCase = (string) => {
  let upperCase = string.toUpperCase();
  let lowerCase = string.toLowerCase();
  let upperCaseLetters = upperCase.split('');
  let lowerCaseLetters = lowerCase.split('');
  let newString = '';
  for (let i = 0; i < upperCaseLetters.length; i++) {
    let upperCaseLetter = upperCaseLetters[i];
    let lowerCaseLetter = lowerCaseLetters[i];
    if (upperCaseLetter === lowerCaseLetter) {
      newString += upperCaseLetter;
    } else {
      newString += lowerCaseLetter;
    }
  }
  return newString;
};

<|endoftext|>/*Return medi an o f elem e nts in  the list  l.
  >>> median([3, 1, 2, 4, 5])
  3
  >>> median([-10, 4, 6, 1000, 10, 20])
  8.0
  */
const median = (l) => {
  if (l.length < 2) return l[0];
  let mid = Math.floor(l.length / 2);
  let left = median(l.slice(0, mid));
  let right = median(l.slice(mid));

const pluck = (arr) => {

  */
const numericalLetterGrade = (grades) => {
  const letterGrades = grades.map((grade) => grade + 'A')
  const letterGradeArray = letterGrades.split('')
  const letterGradeArrayLength = letterGradeArray.length
  const letterGradeArrayMap = new Map()
  for (let i = 0; i < letterGradeArrayLength; i++) {
    letterGradeArrayMap.set(letterGradeArray[i], i)
  }
  return letterGradeArrayMap.values
}

const primeLength = (string) => {
  let len = string.length;

  for (let i = 2; i <= len; i++) {

  }
  return prime;
